intro: Halophila ovalis subsp. bullosa, commonly known as the bullosa sea horse tail, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the Alismataceae family. It is characterized by its elongated, ribbon-like leaves that are often curved or twisted, and it produces small, white flowers. This species thrives in shallow, coastal waters and is commonly found in seagrass beds. It plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms. Its presence is an indicator of healthy, nutrient-rich marine environments.
